definition: to weave/to plait/to organize/to group/to arrange/to edit/to compile/to write/to compose/to fabricate

sentences.english: The cataloging work of the library needs more high-quality catalogers.
sentences.chinese: 图书馆的编目业务需要更高素质的编目员。

sentences.english: The cataloging work of the library needs more high-quality catalogers.
sentences.chinese: 图书馆的编目业务需要更高素质的编目员。

sentences.english: Japanese in the library cataloguing is not used frequently.
sentences.chinese: 日文在图书馆编目语种中属于小语种。

sentences.english: Cataloging tool which generates LC main entry and geographic Cutter numbers.
sentences.chinese: 编目产生LC的工具主要入口和地理切割器数。

sentences.english: How many catalogers does it take to change a light bulb?
sentences.chinese: 换一个灯泡需要多少编目馆员？

sentences.english: The copy cataloging is the main method for our country's western language cataloging.
sentences.chinese: 套录编目是我国西文编目的主要方式。

sentences.english: This paper introduces the duplicate checking in the process of cataloging and the description of bibliographic citations.
sentences.chinese: 介绍了图书编目过程中的查重工作和书目数据的著录。

sentences.english: And hugs to all my cataloging friends out there.
sentences.chinese: 我要拥抱我所有做编目工作的朋友。

sentences.english: But what will happen to the library's role in preservation, cataloging, and circulation?
sentences.chinese: 但是图书馆在保存，编目和流通中的角色将如何变化？

sentences.english: On other fronts, catalogers may have hit a soft spot in the market in procurement.
sentences.chinese: 在其他方面，编目可能触及软现货市场的采购。

sentences.english: Some catalog tables have parent-child relationships.
sentences.chinese: 有些编目表还存在父子关系。

sentences.english: You can use those system catalogs to verify the information about federated objects.
sentences.chinese: 您可以使用那些系统编目来检验关于联邦对象的信息。

sentences.english: Long Tongue League's colleagues are fatigued with cataloguing.
sentences.chinese: 长舌联合会的同僚们编目次编累了。

sentences.english: Catalog tables are not affected by this option.
sentences.chinese: 但是编目表不受这个选项的影响。

sentences.english: The new books are being catalogued.

definition: to file away/to place on file
books (in a library or bookstore)/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]
Siku Quanshu (collection of books compiled during Qing dynasty)
to select and edict/to edit extracts
clauses and sub-clauses (in formal document)/entry (in a dictionary, encyclopedia etc)
